clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Rapid Virologic Response Among HCV Patients Treated With PegIntron and Rebetol in Brazil (Study P05427)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Rapid Virological Response in HCV Patients Treated With PegIntron and Ribavirin - APEGIN Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to evaluate, in each group, the number of participants who achieve rapid virological response (RVR) after 4 weeks treatment with PegIntron and Rebetol. The study will also assess whether RVR is a reliable predictor of sustained virologic response (defined as undetectable viral load at 24 weeks post-treatment).

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Rapid Virologic Response After 4 Weeks of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Rapid virologic response (RVR) was defined as Hepatitis C Virus Ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) negative after 4 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Achieved Sustained Virologic Response (SVR)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR was defined as non-detectable HCV RNA 24 weeks post-treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With RVR Who Also Achieved SVR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at Treatment Week 4 (RVR) and 24 weeks post-treatment (SVR)
secondary_outcome.description: RVR was defined as HCV RNA negative after 4 weeks of treatment. SVR was defined as non-detectable HCV RNA 24 weeks or more post-treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Response at Treatment Week 48 for Genotypes 2 and 3, and Treatment Week 72 for Genotypes 1, 4, and 5, in Participants With RVR
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who achieved RVR at Treatment Week 4 who were considered to have SVR (non-detectable HCV RNA at Treatment Week 48 for genotypes 2 and 3, and Treatment Week 72 for genotypes 1, 4, and 5). Participants from the Mono-infected with HCV group and the Co-infected with HCV and HIV group, were identified as either Genotype 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Baseline Characteristics in Participants With SVR
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline characteristics assessed were age, gender, and genotype.

arm_group.description: Participants infected with Hepatitis C Virus (HCV).
Participants co-infected with HCV and Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV).

intervention.description: PegIntron administered in accordance with approved labeling
Rebetol administered in accordance with approved labeling

study_pop.textblock: Participants infected with Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) who are undergoing treatment with PegIntron and Rebetol in accordance with approved labeling at approximately 60 sites in Brazil. Participants could be treatment-naïve, undergoing re-treatment, or co-infected with Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Willing to participate in the study and sign the Informed Consent Form
- Established HCV infection, confirmed by molecular biology test (positive qualitative polymerase chain reaction [PCR] test)
- Can be treatment-naïve, have retreatment, or co-infected with HIV
- Be under treatment with PegIntron in combination with ribavirin, starting up to 14 days before the screening visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants who have not confirmed their willingness to participate in the study or have refused to sign the Free and Informed Consent Form
- Prior treatment with PegIntron (combined with ribavirin or not)
- History of alcohol abuse in the past 6 months
- Decompensated liver disease
- Severe heart disease
- Decompensated thyroid disorder
- Neoplasia
- Type 1 diabetes mellitus - uncontrolled or hardly controlled
- Seizures - uncontrolled
- Primary immune deficiency
- Men and women not using appropriate contraceptive methods
- Pregnancy or lactation
- For participants co-infected with HIV: HIV-related opportunistic disease in the past 6 months or CD4 count lower than 200 cells/mm^3
